author: potuz
content: I think one of the issues is that either <@695019898274840626> 's or <@291925846556540928>'s proposals leave open the door for congestions on both the entry and exit queue with validators just withdrawing to create new ones with 32ETH. <@144468805697929216>'s alleviates this issue by allowing excess transfer.

author: jgm
content: Yeah, the basic idea is to have a mechanism for transfers that avoids users having to carry out withdrawal-as-transfer.

author: emansipater
content: As I noted on ethresear.ch I think there is an easy amendment to jgm's proposal that integrates it smoothly with either of mine or <@!291925846556540928>'s proposals, reduces the complexity, and adds no new capabilities to either key (nor does it require the withdrawal key to become or remain "hot").  https://ethresear.ch/t/simple-transfers-of-excess-balance/8263/5?u=technocrypto

author: potuz
content: I don't think it's so trivial to integrate <@144468805697929216>'s proposal to <@291925846556540928>'s as the latter relies on the exit mechanism and uses a flag to keep a list of withdrawn validators. It's possible to implement but I think it will change the essence of the simplicity of that proposal
